p: One identified binder of the cytoplasmic tail of M2 is annexin A6 (AnxA6) [ 158], a Ca 2+/lipid-binding scaffold protein that interacts with lipid rafts and regulates cholesterol homeostasis. siRNA-silencing of AnxA6 expression has enhanced viral release, while its overexpression has resulted in reduced viral titer, suggesting that AnxA6 negatively regulates IAV infection [ 158]. It is speculated that AnxA6 may interact with the M2 cytoplasmic tail during membrane scission, although it remains to be elucidated how this hostâ€“pathogen interaction may contribute to the impairment of IAV budding and release.
